data.message: Please undo this whole "messenger" app thing. I don't want 2 apps on my phone just so I can use Facebook!

replies.message: Hi Will. We hear your concern. Separating messages from the Facebook app into Messenger allows us to provide a better overall experience to the Facebook community, and linking between the two apps is quick and easy. -Elissa
Facebook please undo the separation. its so annoying!

It's not quick or easy, Elissa. Why doesn't Facebook actually take their users opinions into consideration? When a majority of people are saying they dislike something, instead of forcing it down their throats, why don't you listen to them and change it back?
Exactly who's experience?  It's my experience to enjoy choice and I also hate having 2 apps.  AND it is quicker and easier to have one button not two to click between.  Please listen to the fans!!

Leave the messenger for those who want it, but leave the old style for others who don't.  That seems like a great compromise! I'm actually using Facebook less because of this change as I'm sure others are as well.
Why should we have to have TWO apps taking up space and memory on our phone just to fully use your website? It would only truly be "quick and easy" if it was all one app.
what a wonderful world on facebook

I totally agree with you. I also wish that we could block Family/Friends from sending what is called Pass It On on messenger, cos it gets really annoying when that's all some send instead of actually messaging
